title: SoC CSD 303-0-20 Brain and Cognition

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will review cognitive foundations (e.g. perception, attention, memory, executive) for processing symbol systems (i.e. visual words, spoken words and numbers) with a focus on neural basis and development.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prior exposure to neuroscience or cognitive science is helpful, but is not required.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Review relevant behavioral and neuroanatomical research
Describe gross organization of the brain
Describe methods of studying the brain basis of communication (e.g. electrophysiological, neuroimaging, lesion)
Understand perceptual (e.g. visual, auditory) foundations of communication and its development
Understand attention, memory and executive function foundations of communication and its development
Describe models of information processing and symbolic representation (e.g. visual words, spoken words, numbers)
Understand cortical organization and development of word processing (e.g. phonological, orthographic and semantic)
Describe precursors and development of reading and spelling
Discuss how breakdown in lexical systems, and in broader cognitive functions, may lead to deficits in reading and spelling
Describe models of number processing, and the cortical organization and development of calculation
